transcript.content: Coldplay - Speed of Sound
Coldplay. Speed of sound. Steve, I know you eh, like an insight to my um, musical taste and all that
Always
But, that's my favourite Coldplay track of all time, I just thought I'd eh, just throw that in
Not a fan of clocks?
Uhh, no I think I've uh, overplayed parachutes a little bit an- but that's my favourite one, like it.
I'm afraid to say I'm a bit of a philistine when it comes to Coldplay, that sounds the same as all the other ones. I'm sorry to say
Oh.. You'll have to meet these boys one day
Yeah well, well I'll tell them to their face, I don't care. Little bit rock 'n roll.
Ricky Laughs
I don't care
Well, I'm Ricky Gervais, that little uh, funny little worzel type voice over there is Stephen Merchant. And with us our, producer, Karl Pilkington. All right?
All right
Whatever we say producer, of course, that is in inverted commas.
Yeah.
Done with the fingers.

Well ye- he didn't have it, I wanted to play something off my iPod today to record it 'cause they didn't have it here, um, it's a great track called Antony and the Johnsons. He didn't even have the lead. He went alrigh-
Right

Typical. And he, and he went is it any good? I went yeah it's really good, and he went why haven't we got it here already then? Oh! Oh that's th- yeah, that's the paradigm is it? If XFM haven't got it, it's no good. 4 Non Blondes doing well is it, that still in the cupboard, is it? Unbelievable. We're a little bit annoyed today aren't we actually
I'm really annoyed
Yeah. All that stuff we did last week. Um, th- that lindauer sent us some sparkling wine, and we thought right, we're, well you, shamelessly plugged it
Yeah.
How many times did you mention it? About 20 times?
I must have mentioned it about 20 times.
We're, we're, the finale was hitting Karl on the head with a cork. That's on my website by the way.
Okay
Rickygervais.com, go there and see Karl being hit in the head with a cork.
Yeah
Right, and we and we said let's send us free stuff and we'd talk about it.
Nothing. The, the, the, the cupboard is empty
I mean literally nothing
The cupboard is bare.
No one has thought, I tell you what, there's t-, there's, there's those guys from, the office.
Yeah.
Uh- eh- I- I mean..
I mean let's be honest, Rick. We are taste makers.
Yeah
We are opinion formers, you and I
Yeah, yeah
And you know, you'd have thought if anyone was going to send us some free stuff.
Yeah, I, I, I'll mention them all.
You know? It makes me fume
Yeah
And you know what it is? It's because people, PR people and that they've realised, no one's listening.
But not only are we going against all our principles and losing our dignity just for some free stuff
And integrity
And integrity yeeeeaah-
Steve spazzes out
We're going against XFM policy because, we are, obvi- obviously they would have got, thousands of pounds for lindauer to be mentioned last week
Oh come on, Rick
20 time- no well no..
It's XFM, Rick
40 quid for.. 40 quid for a nine minute advert.
Ex- exactly
So advertise your, to- quality stuff
Yeah
Jeff's Garage. Cheaper than some other garages. Uhh, it would- it do with, uhh, anyon- uh, uh, actually..
Didn't we play an advert once for a tattoo parlour?
Ye- Yes!
Do you remember that? I'm sure we played an advert for a tattoo parlour
Yeah
I mean co- what tattoo parlour can afford to advertise on a radio station? Unless it's a tinpot one like this
Oh God! I've got good, some good music today though, Steve
Oh really, I hope so, I'll be the judge of that, go on, but go on
We- wha- we- AC/DC?
Ohhh!

metadata.song_track: You Shook Me All Night Long

transcript.content: AC/DC - You Shook Me All Night Long

Have you got a bit of ah, bare skin, you need ah, colouring in? Come along to, ah.. Ron's bike shop and tattoo parlour. He'll write "mum", on your hand and give your Harley a tune up, while you wait. I can't believe no one wants to advertise with us.
And that only costs, what, 20 quid?
Yeah
And they play that-
I mean, I turned down millions of pounds to do adverts, because I think it's beneath me, I don- and I thought last week I'll give a little bit back. I'll give. I'll excite all these people
- who want to get a little bit...
Nothing.
All I'm thinking is Steve, either, our cache has gone down, no one wants us any more -
Mmhmm
Which is impossible, surely.
I would have thought so.
Or, we're on a tin pot station that no one listens to, now...
Ding! Correct answer.
Ricky Laughs
Unbelievable. I'm having to hold on the pop-shield of this mic because it keeps falling off.
It's embarrassing.
It's awful. I mean, oh god. Well Karl, what are your thoughts? Why have you stuck it out here?
Uhh...
Nothing better coming, I'd have thought.

Well I'll tell you why, 'cause your always on holiday, you don't do a lot, you get paid, you know, well, doesn't he really? He's a moaning - I mean, he doesn't try and get on at all, he doesn't deal with people, he moans about everything, and, you know, so he's -
I'm all right, I've got me own little room and that.
Yeah

Like a cage, it is like a cage, isn't it? and you can shut the door, shut the door. If people - "I said, shut the door" He doesn't want them looking in, he's like a, he's like a miserable old chimp. We noticed today how much he's simian, isn't he?
He's very strange, actually, maybe we should try and get a picture on the website, because Karl's arms are particularly chimp-like, its very very strange.
They really are, because he's got that sort of, he's got long downy hair.
And the long extended knuckles.

Yeah, yeah, and his totally round face, that sort of, the chin goes back and the dome of his cranium. I think, quite seriously; I know we sort of share about 98.5% of our genetic material with bonobos and chimpanzees, but I think he's got a little bit more.
Yeah
I honestly think he's a little bit of a throwback, just his line, they just kept to this sort of really, the ugliest one in the cave.
Yeah
- and the tree, and he really didn't, he didn't come out of it. I'm not saying you are, you know, I don't think you, well you are, you're chip like.
No, it does, it does annoy me, me hair annoys me, on me body an' that, because I've got, I've got like hair on me, on my little toes and that.
Have ya?
And on the legs-
Would you, your little toes, can you pick things up with them?
I've never tried.
Okay
Well, that's, that's, that's the finale of this week's show. We're gonna see if he can play a record and put the fader up -
From a tyre, while swinging on a tyre.
Yeah, just using his toe - his hairy toes.
Yeah, unbelievable.
I sort of got hair all the way, but then it just runs out where it should be.
On the top of your head.
I know, yeah.
Is this part of the reason why you're always uncomfortable about, you know, being nude or around naked people?
Uhhh..
Is that part of the reason do you think, 'cause you look so grotesque?
Well, when I'm on holiday I don't really like wondering about without a top on unless, like, it's a quiet beach or whatever.
: Sure, so what would you normally wear?

There's no need. Just like a nice sort of light, summery, sort of linen shirt maybe, just a few top buttons open, but I don't, yeah, I don't like, the naked body isn't that nice anyways is it? Know what I mean? Whatever it is, if you're a cat and you're shaved, you don't look that nice. Know what I mean? But with the hair on it -
I think you'll find the cat is naked even with its fur on, cats don't wear clothes.
No, but what I mean is, a bald cat isn't that good.
No
You know, you know, it does me head in that I'm bald. I'm not you know, if I could have hair it would be nice, but that's life, innit?
Would you prefer animals to wear clothes like Mickey Mouse does, or Goofy?
You know that I don't like nudists and all that, we've done it.

But don't you think sometimes, you could sort of like, maybe, um, I don't know, fancify a little bit? Like um, if there was such a thing as an ape salon, and there isn't Karl, there isn't, right, would you, you know, give a orangutan a trim, maybe sort out his hair, 'cause some of those look like they're going bald, but they've got a comb over haven't they?
They should just have a shave -
When it’s like that, that’s what I did, take it back.
And the underarms as well. Yeah, they really got a lot of underarm hair. Even the women one's-
Really? That’s disgusting.
I know, I don't know-I don't even know why they breed. I don't how they get laid- Some of those horrible, old, hairy, ginger, orangutans.
Yeah, they are particularly grim, some of those.
I know, yeah.
The big ones-
Ginger ones. Yeah. They can't be a happy, can they?
What is that, why’s, why is, where did that-happen? The the ginger thing? Why do people give them, like, a hard time an’ that?
Well you just gave them a hard time then, so why did you do it?—
Well people do give-I don't understand why, but Ginger people get quite a bit of stick, and I've never understood it.
No, It’s just, I don’t know why.
I mean, they do, don’t they?
I don't know, it might be historical. It might have been because, I don’t- I’m sure it’s not everywhere in the world. I'm sure it's probably -
No, they have, They’re always, I’ve said to you about, like-
Ginger cats are always fat because they’re sort of sick of it, probably.
Play a record, Karl
Wait wait wait, what do you mean, ginger cats- what do you mean they’re sick of it?
Well, when you see a ginger cat-
They've been eating like because they're upset, they’re being bullied-whatever?
Yeah, because they’re fed up and that, you never see a thin, happy Ginger Cat running about, it's always overweight, looking a bit fed up. It's just a good point, innit?
I wouldn’t say it’s a good point, Karl, it’s a point-
So last week, the Chinese don't age well, now, anything Ginger, including cats, are sick of it.
No, but I, I'm just saying I don’t
Are you ginger? Would you like to take issue with any of Karl’s points? 83Xfm is the text, you can text us, Maybe you’ve got- maybe you've seen a thin ginger cat-
I’m not going to go though. That's what I'm saying. I'm just saying it's weird how people give ‘em a hard time, and if, if I could have hair, I'd go for ginger hair rather than being bald.
Really?
Hmmm
Ben Folds - Landed
Landed from Ben Folds on XFM 104.9 Ricky Gervais, Steven Merchant, Karl Pilkington

Had a fax, never mind champagne- and freebies like that, forget that. We're not doing that anymore. It didn't work. Okay, but, we are still in demand. Got a fax here. All right, “So guys, I produce a program for the BAS Scientists, right, wintering in Antartica”. Now, what this bloke is saying is, there are scientists-right- researching in Antarctica and they’ll soon, they’re already locked away and sort of like, out of touch cause they can't get to them.
But they’re soon going to be living in 24-hour darkness, because through the midsummer here, it's - it's darkness for 24 hours for like, three months,
Jeeze

And they’re totally cut off, and he’s trying to get some stuff together, and he wants us to record a message, and it says, every year they choose a celebrity to do something, a message of their choice, They had, Rolf Harris, David Attenborough and Jonathan Ross. “This year, Ricky is the popular choice.”
Mh-hmm...
So, I'm up there with Rolf Harris, David Attenborough and Jonathan Ross.
In-in terms of the vote amongst some scientists stuck in a hut in Antarctica for three months, so...
I think they've just-they've just got cabin fever. They've got-
So that's another po-so that's another poll I've won. British Antarctic scientists in a hut poll.
If I was trapped in a little room with several other men for three months of pitch darkness-
Ooh, sexist.
Or indeed women.
Yeah.
I can't imagine why I'd ever want a message from Rolf Harris.
(laughs)
What is wrong-I mean David Attenborough, fascinating.
Well I assume
It's the si-it's the-it's the animal. I assume they're researching penguins or something aren't they? If they're stuck out there. Or maybe-
But what's that got to do with Rolf?
-seismic activity or maybe polar uh uh shift, I don't know.
Possibly if you were researching kangaroos...
Yeah. Well he knows about all animals, doesn't he? You can take him a budgie with a broken wing and he'll sort it out. Or he knows a man who does.
Sure.
He can y'know he'll sort that out for ya. And he'll do a picture of it.
(laughs)
While you wait. So uh-But anyway, I thought 'they want a fight minute message'. We can do
Better than that. Let's dedicate the whole show to them, Steve.
We're gonna do what?
Dedicate the whole show to them. What was it, trouble with my diction?
A little bit. I'm just thinking again y'know we've gotta slow down cos these guys are there, they're working, they're busy.
They're used to uh speaking eloquent English
Yeah exactly. They're used to talking to intelligent, yeah educated people. So Karl should be something of a surprise to them. I imagine they'll just flood back early to come back to study him.
(laughs) So, this is uh this show is dedicated to all you scien- I know nothing about them. I don't know how many there are. I know
They just... as I say in a hut somewhere. Presumably with a laptop. Drinking uh hot chocolate out of steel mugs with-
Just looking up porn.
(laughs) Well they're not on the internet, are they?
Oh are they not?
Well no there's no phone line.
Well how do they charge up the laptop, when it runs out?
Well they've probably got generators.
They must have other stuff though. They've got Tele and that, haven't they?
Of course they haven't.
No for DVDs and things.
Well they could probably-yeah they could probably have a DVD player that would run off a generator and stuff. So they could play-I don't know what we're giving
This on CD or something.
Hmm.
But um..
And what are-what-

How can that enhance your life though? That you-two months has gone, you've sat there. You're chewing Kendal mint cake and uh just looking around at a white wall thinking that The Thing is going to come in any minute and put you out of your misery.
(laughs) Yeah.
And you go 'Alright lads it's here', 'what?', 'five minute message from Ricky Gervais'.
(laughs) Yeah.
"Eh, fella from The Office', 'Oh yeah. Go on'. I mean-
Yeah.
-so I don't know I can enhance-I mean I get compared to-
One of them's going 'I voted for Ricky Martin! What?'
(laughing) Yeah.
But I don't understand
Um, what they're researching. Now, you said penguins but that's just a hypothesis.
Well we're assuming that cos it's Antarctica wh-where... the uh the penguins live.
Is there anything else there? What else is going on?
There's a lot-
There's presumably climate differences-
Well yeah cos it's a-
-and atmospheric changes and so on.

-land mass isn't it? Arctic's just on ice and Ant-is actually a continent. It's a land mass. So there's stuff there. But presumably not in the winter. I imagine it's like ten foot of snow and really not a lot happening.
Sure.
I don't know what the research and they could be

It could be, er, astronomy - as I say - it could be some sort of seismic thing, it could be just testing polar melting. It could be, it could be Penguins. I've no idea. I haven't got the information. I don't think they wanted us to go into what they're doing.
I suppose they already know, yeah.
They probably want to know what's happening in the world for... oh... well, we've got the man here.

That's an interminable five minutes for them. They've already, we've already wasted that five minutes. They're gonna put all excited to hear from you and they just got five minutes discussing what they might be doing.

Hold on though, what I'm worried about worried about is [inaudible] for these, for these 10 people there, we've just annoyed the 200 listeners we've got. 'Cos they're thinking "what's in this for me?". Well, we'll have fun along the way and what I think we're doing - they've been stuck there, as I say, they're out of touch. They don't know what's happening. So Karl Pilkington is the man, we're gonna have a break, have a song maybe some ad breaks and then Karl is going to let these scientists, who are stuck away in the darkness, know what's been happening for the last couple weeks. Is that alright Karl?
You know I don't really follow the news so...
Oh play a record!
Embrace - A Glorious Day
Embrace, a glorious day. Well, is it Glorious Day - Steve?
Brilliant.
Every day's a glorious day, isn't it?
Well is when I'm with you.
Yeah love the world - so these scientists are stuck away in the Darkness.

So let's tell them what they've been missing. What's the highlights Karl, of the last - Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, Karl Pilkington by the way Xfm 104.9 umm, etcetera. What's what have they missed for the last, just do the last few weeks. What have they missed? Remember they haven't got newspapers, they haven't got telly. What-what's the... Look at him, he's looking at me like I just said that in Arabic - what don't you understand? Think what what's happened, think what they haven't got that you know about.
What have you seen and heard in the last couple of weeks that they couldn't have?
What like on the news and that? What's gone on in the world and that?
Well or just things you've done personally, I think that'll be of less interest.
Yeah.
Pope's dead.
Okay.
[laughing] I like... imagine that. Imagine if that was the breaking it to them. They're listening in and go "what's happened? Pope's dead?". Well don't say it like that. Break it to us gently Karl.

But I think that's better than how they do it on the news normally though. Isn't it? They make a big deal out of it, and you panic a bit when it says Breaking News and you think "oh, there's a war on" and they go "popes dead" and you go "oh".
So you've just a short shot tactic.
Yeah.
Like ripping a plaster off quickly.
I've just said it softly though, didn't I? Pope's dead.

You know all that coverage of the Pope with like millions of people that have gathered in Rome and stuff. I was thinking about, remember we talked about the Queen Mother, and they were queuing up and queueing up and queueing up to see the pope.
Yeah. Like four hours to get a glimpse.
And once again I couldn't help but feel if they popped on some kind of like dessert trolley and just wheeled him past everyone else. They could have gone and done it about three-quarters of an hour.
Yeah
You know, once again people not thinking - they're not expanding their minds.
Tell you what happened to me...
What like students on rag week with the bed down Oxford street.
Put him on one of those novelty beds, They're all dressed in...
- kind of Cardinals gear.
Yeah.
Just, you know, trundle him off and down ... the yeah.
It's the way they also said they've now got a new pope, he's hardly new is he? Why didn't they learn from the last one?
Sure
Keep taking on old people.
Yeah, yeah
Me dad couldn't even get a gig in B&Q and he's younger.
Ricky continues laughing

Oh God, so who have we offended? I mean the thing is is because soon our offensiveness isn't going to be sort of like we feel a bit guilty about friends- it's going to be like we're going to be living with Salman Rushdie.
Yeah
I mean, the things that, I mean, that, that's pretty, you know, don't have a go at the pope.

I'm not having a go at him, I mean, it's good that he can carry on working and what have you, but I thought everyone had to retire at like 60, whatever, bloody hell, but you know, whatever, if you can get away with it.
Yeah, why couldn't your dad get a gig in B&Q? I mean he goes there a lot
(Simultaneous) Cause he's a thieving bastard!
He goes there a lot.

Thats why! If you are just joining us, joining us for this one-off show because you're trapped in a bunker somewhere in the Antarctic you should know this of Karl's dad. He's a thief, he steals things and we've openly discussed this before, he steals things from other elderly ladies and other elderly people, perhaps -
He's not like Raffles though, he doesn't go into their house.
He's not a gentleman thief.
No, whats-it, people put - let's put this in context. You know, he's not, he's not a villain, but sometimes when people leave groceries lying around in a public telephone box -
No, what it was, where they live now, they're retired, right? Moved. Wont say where they are, but somewhere quiet, right, and it's so quiet -
It's not a witness relocation
- protection scheme.
But, because, because there's only about eight people live in this village it's not worth like, the like corner shop staying open.
There's only eight people living in the village?
It's quiet, it is quiet.
The Village of the Damned
So anyway, so rather than keep the shop open, you're meant to call up and go, "All right, Harry, I need some milk today"
Right
And they stick it in a phone box outside in the shop, and me dad found that out. So when he's been out, just stop off at the phone-box, have a look at what's left lying around.
Yeah, but of the eight, I mean if there's eight people in the village, my attention would be instantly drawn to the dodgy Manc fella.
Hmm.

I mean, you know what I mean? It seems, in Manchester you probably get away with this, there's a lot of scum up there, but down in this little village, you know, you got Little Miss Marple type and a little, you know country policeman.
He's stopped doing now
Has he?
He's not doing it.
Cleaned up his act.
Yeah.
Yep
Good. Alright, so the Pope's dead, any other big news?
Umm, there was that thing I told you about last week. The footlong spider. Eats chicken. Uh...
What does this mean to them? They're going to think the world has been taken over by them. It's like we're not going back, there's a footlong spider on the loose.
Are these people bright though?
Well, let's have a look, Antarctic Scientists? Yeah. Yeah, they probably got an O-level or two.
Yeah but they're looking at penguins all day.
Ye- I?
So how bright do you gotta be?
What you mean?
Well, what are they doing?
Well I don't know, do I? But they've been chosen.
This probably cost millions of pounds to set them up there, they're probably, yeah - Oh, Karl.
This is, I'll tell you, this is like, for scientists, this is like "Big Brother". This is like a Big Brother Challenge.
Yeah
That's a good idea-
Watching this, finding out what's going to go on, those little challenges that they give them, little tasks.
It's like Celebrity Love Island without the sun and slappers.
Mmm
I'm trying to think what else, what was going on.
Well while you're thinking I should just tell you now you threw that question out earlier, why are ginger people historically mocked, we've had a couple of responses on the text.
83 Xfm, again, as ever with xfm listeners, don't believe what they say. Don't trust what they say. But one of them -
Have we got any respect for anyone in the world?

Umm, get back to you. Pete in Tooting, now again, I think this is nonsense. He claims that the reason ginger people have disliked is because Judas was Ginger, from the Bible. How - I don't know where he's come up with this idea.
No, I've heard that.
But I mean are there a great many people from, you know, the Middle East who are ginger?
Well, that's probably why he stood out
Sure
- and he's, he was probably fed up, and he thought, "I'll get him back". Maybe -
Unless he was wearing, unless he had his hair dyed Ginger when he was on the witness protection scheme.
What did he do?
Which presumably he had to go into after it all came out in the book.
What did he do? What's...
He stitched up, he stitched him up to the Romans, didn't he, Judas, didn't he do it for 40 piece of silver, I'm not big on the Bible, but apparently -
Incidentally, if you'd like us to a stitch-up any kind of Messiah for 40 pieces of silver, just get in touch at 83XFM.

We're willing to do that for you as well. Um, but that's one explanation, there's another one here, which is again, I don't believe this for a moment, it says here, "ginger people get a lot of stick because in Elizabethan times, people with ginger hair were told that their mother had slept with the devil, and that was why their hair was, their hair was ginger. So there's two options. Maybe if you've got some more you can, any more spurious thoughts, then get in touch 83XFM, but yeah, Karl?
I don't know, there might be truth in both of those. I mean the truth, the point is, that if either of those are true they were already being picked on, if you know what I mean.
Right
That's the point.
Mmm
It's sort of like, maybe that's not the, uh, the total root of it. Well the Judas thing might be the root of it, the first big ginger to do something a little bit off.
So, if he was bald, then all bald people would be like-
Yeah
Getting a hard time and that.
Yeah.
Well, we do mock you behind your back anyway, Karl. That's going on, don't worry.
Alright
So play a record and think of something that's happened to tell these poor scientists what's going on in the world.
Alright
All you've come up with so far is the Pope's dead, and there's a big spider. What is that?
It eats chicken.
The Pogues - "Rainy Night in SoHo"
The Pogues, "Rainy Night in SoHo". I hope there is no rainy night in SoHo tonight, Rick.
Alright

I'm sure you're one of those who agrees with me. We've just had an email from a guy called James Lee. He says, "Hi, just writing a bit of info on the scientists in Antarctica. I'm a scientist who's just come back from one of the Antarctic bases called Hallie" or Haley. "There are 15 people staying there over the Antarctic winter. The scientists are looking mainly at the atmosphere things like the ozone hole and meteorology

Energy. I think there are six scientists staying over the winter, as well as a doctor, electrician, mechanic and a carpenter and so on. And so he's saying uhh, they do listen, they can't, they have the internet so they maybe can listen to the show on the internet and if you get the chance say hi to Francis and the rest of the winter is for me. Sure, no problem, yeah, thanks James. But yeah, there they are. That's what they're doing. That's what they're up to.
But why, why are they asking you for a message though when, I mean, have these people got families and that or are they convicts or what?
I don't. No. What do you mean, of course they got.
They probably do get messages from their family.
Why are you doing one for one. Is that? I mean, say, d'you know like you see in like Porridge and stuff like that, where if someone's in prison and no one visits 'em.
Yeah.
And they sort of look a bit fed up and that. Is this message that you're doing for like people who don't get a letter in the post from?
Brilliant. So they, they put this on the shelf until someone doesn't get one. "Alright Hargreaves." "Yes sir, I didn't get a message today sir." "You have got a message, Hargreaves."

"I've what sir?" "Hargreaves you have got a message." "Really sir?" "From Ricky Gervais." "Really sir?" And then they give it. Don't talk. Don't talk. Please, there are scientists listening. Try to keep the talking shit down to a minimum today.
What's annoying me is here, right. They're saying they're stuck over there for months, but it seems to me like they're wasting a lot of time. Right.
Why?
Well, you're saying they probably watch DVDs, they're saying they've got internet access.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Was I wrong?
Listening, listening to messages. Get the job done and go home. Do it in a week.
Well that's subtle. Well then we don't have to tell 'em anything then cause they, they listen to the internet. If they've got the internet then yeah, its a waste of time. Good point, play a record.

Well hang on, before that. Here's a good point. You've had long time to research what's been going on in the world. We've just had an email here from Nicholas who says, "why haven't you told them about the recent Pig Olympics that just went on in China?" You've missed that one Karl once again.
Who won?

'First of the gang to die' - Morrissey, XFM104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Well Karl, you've failed miserably. There's scientists stuck away. Right, one more chance. What, what's happened in the last couple of weeks? Just one more chance to, what have you seen in the last couple of weeks?
Ahh well, like I said, I don't, I don't really watch the news an' that.
Right.
So I can't tell 'em about that. But in a way, I think they're better off not knowing, I think that's the only good thing about being out there innit. Not knowing about the bad stuff going on.
Yeah,
So, I can't help 'em there.
They don't need to look at the weather do they?
No, don't need to. But uhh, I told you that the pope an' that.
Yeah, pretty extensive.
